intro: Pavetta trichardtensis var. jabulanii, commonly known as the Jabulanii Pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories.
